page.title: 05MEDICAL CHECKS ON ST.MARTINS
page.content: Within the islands we have one dentist and he has a small surgery in the Health Centre on the main island, complete with dentists chair and surgical equipment.Therefore a boat trip is necessary before treatment can begin.However he vists our school once a year in the summer term, to check our mouthes for gum and tooth disorders.An optician from the mainland visits four times a year and you go to St.Marys for your test.The audiologist also comes four times a year.You have your test at St.Marys Health Centre,unless there are a lot of children needing to be tested on the smaller off islands.In that case she visits them in their schools.Maybe it is a disadvantage to cross four kilometres of water for medical checks,but we do not have long waiting lists.
